COURSES.name: U.S. Health Care System
COURSES.description: Overview of organization, delivery and financing of health services in the U.S. Topics include health professionals, health care facilities, financing of health services, managed care and current health policy issues.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: APK 2105C, and BSC 2007 or BSC 2005 or BSC 2010, and PSY 2012 and STA 2023; health science or communication sciences and disorders majors or health science minor.

COURSES.name: Introduction to Health Professions
COURSES.description: Lecture, discussion and group assignments provide the opportunity to learn about different disciplines making up a health care team and their role in both the science and practice of health care.

COURSES.name: Survey of Diseases and Disability
COURSES.description: Overview of medical and psychosocial aspects of chronic diseases and disability.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: health science or communication sciences and disorders majors or health science minor.

COURSES.name: Therapeutic Communication Skills with Patients, Families and the Health Care Team
COURSES.description: Learn appropriate verbal and nonverbal behavior to be used with patients, families and the health care team through lecture, discussion and role play in large and small groups.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 2; Prereq: HSA 3111, HSC 3502, HSC 4558 and health science majors only; Coreq: RCS 4415L.

COURSES.name: Clinical Observation / Health Care Volunteer Work
COURSES.description: Learn about a specific health care field or gain knowledge about specific patient or client populations through direct observation and/or hands-on assistance. (S-U)
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: health science majors only and department permission.

COURSES.name: Health Care Leadership: Skills and Styles
COURSES.description: Behavioral styles that contribute to leadership effectiveness. Studies specific styles for their contributions to motivating people and overall leadership effectiveness in health care.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: HSA 3111, HSC 3502, HSC 4558 and health science majors only.

COURSES.name: Individual Study
COURSES.description: Supervised program of study to investigate problems significant to health professions.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 1 to 4; can be repeated with change in content up to 16 credits. Prereq: Health education and behavior majors, junior or senior standing, HSC 3032 with minimum grade of C, and faculty member or program coordinator permission.

COURSES.name: Special Topics
COURSES.description: Special topics in health science.  Please refer to the department for specific course information.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 1 to 4; can be repeated with change in content up to 12 credits.

COURSES.name: Public Health and Health Professions Senior Honors Thesis
COURSES.description: Special project leading to the distinction of magna or summa cum laude at graduation. The project can be any creative work that focuses on a specific topic or issue in the health professions. The student develops an outline of the special project prior to project initiation and produces a final paper at project completion. The paper must be approved by the program and dean's office for the student to graduate magna or summa cum laude.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 1 to 6; Prereq: HSC 4969, senior standing, majors only and a 3.75 GPA.

COURSES.name: Introduction to Public Health
COURSES.description: Overview of public health as a multifaceted field. Includes discussion of contemporary public health challenges with input from discipline experts.

COURSES.name: Public Health Concepts
COURSES.description: Introduces the basic tenets, applications and foci of public health, including integrating public health with other health professions.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: (BSC 2007 or BSC 2005 or BSC 2010) and PSY 2012 and STA 2023.

COURSES.name: Service Learning Practicum
COURSES.description: Covers development of the role of a public health and human services provider in an agency setting.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: HSC 3057, PHC 4101, senior standing, and public health majors only.

COURSES.name: Therapeutic Communication Skills Laboratory
COURSES.description: Laboratory for HSC 3661; includes hands-on practice of therapeutic communication skills using simulated patient scenarios.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 1; Prereq: HSC 3502, HSA 3111, HSC 4558; Coreq: HSC 3661, majors only.
